question.questionText: Denise made a circuit to light a bulb or run a motor off a D-cell battery. She used a special switch. Below is the schematic diagram of her circuit. The switch is inside the dotted box. Why will the motor run when she moves the switch to the right?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: There is a complete circuit connecting the motor to the D-cell battery.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: Because the battery is hooked to the switch.
Because Right is to turn off and Left is to turn on.
Because she used the special switch.
Because if you already had a series circuit then it has to be a parallel circuit.
